page.title: 15Geog.Ecology & Environment.
page.content: Over half this block consists of the buildings of the main town of Pontefract.New housing estates have been built since the War,mainly at present towards the South.The Kings High School is situated on the edge of a magnesium limestone outlay at 71m in the mid western square and the ruins of Pontefract Castle stand on a sandstone prominence at 50m in the inner northern square.The new & old Prince of Wales coalmines in the NW square provide employment and coal for Ferrybridge Power Station.Agriculture is mainly arable with oil seed rape becoming common.The Leeds-Goole and York-Sheffield Railway lines and the A1 and M62 roads nearby,serve the town.On farmland,hedges have been removed to create larger more economically sized fields.
